About Me_

who am I?

I'm a front-end developer & designer. Every day I'm driven to design and program experiences that are crisp, semantic, and meaningful. The idea that I work in an industry that requires both creativity and tenacity is something that serves to inspire me daily.

When I'm not building things for the web, you can find me face deep in some science fiction, having a cup of coffee/ earl grey, or thinking up my next short story.

Skills_

things i've learned

Driven by my passion to code and create, my skills provide me with a solid foundation to tackle a variety of projects and challenges. My skillset reflects my drive to grow personally and adapt professionally.

development

My CSS and javascript skills are extremely strong, scaffolded by sturdy and semantic HTML. My front-end frameworks of choice are React and Vue.js. Additionally, I am familiar with express, node and mongo, should there be a project/ challenge that requires a deeper integration with the back-end.

  • JS/ES6

  • JQuery

  • vue.js

  • Firebase

  • express.js

design

I would rate my proficiency with Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop quite highly. My formal training in design allows me to see both sides of a project; This hybrid approach enables me to critically assess my design choices alongside my code. I believe that good design supports robust code, and semantic code lends itself to effective design choices.

  • Responsive Web Design

  • Photoshop

  • Illustrator

  • Typography

  • Layouting

workflow

I'm comfortable working in mixed, collaborative environments. I'm well-versed in git, and have used both gitlab and github for collaboration. I have experience with several popular package / dependency managers, being most comfortable with NPM and bower. My taskrunner/ preprocessor of choice is gulp, and my code editor of choice is Visual Studio Code.

  • Git

  • github

  • terminal

  • Gulp

  • NPM

  • Bower

  • VSC
